title: Nutanix Overview
description: Monitor Nutanix infrastructure health, performance, and resource utilization, by tracking clusters metrics, node / host metrics and VM metrics including IOPS, latency, bandwidth, CPU/memory usage, and storage. Filter by cluster, host, or VM for detailed analysis.

definition.content:
**The Datadog Nutanix dashboard gives you broad visibility into the health, performance, and resource usage of your hyperconverged infrastructure including clusters, hosts, and virtual machines.**

  Further reading for Nutanix monitoring:
  - [Datadog's Nutanix integration docs](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/nutanix)

**Cluster-level aggregated metrics** showing overall capacity and performance across all nodes. Use these to understand total resource availability, storage utilization trends, and cluster-wide I/O patterns.

**Individual host performance metrics** for all nodes in your Nutanix clusters. Monitor per-host CPU, memory, storage usage, and I/O metrics to identify hotspots or failing nodes. Use the host filter to drill down into specific nodes.

definition.title: Host Storage Usage vs Capacity by Host
Host IOPS by Host (Total, Read, Write)
Host IO Latency by Host (Total, Read, Write)

definition.content: **Virtual machine performance and resource metrics** across your Nutanix environment. Track VM CPU/memory utilization, I/O throughput, network traffic, and identify inefficient VMs. Use the VM filter to investigate specific workloads.

## Resource Capacity & Allocation

This section provides visibility into physical capacity (from hosts) vs allocated resources (to VMs) to help with capacity planning and detect overcommitment.
